content:
A mixture of 2,3,5,6-tetrachloro-1,4-dimethyl ester (0.0664 g, 0.20 mmol) and ZnCl2 (0.0136 g, 0.10 mmol) in methanol (3 mL), pyridine (3 mL) and H2O (6 mL) was placed in a sealed vial (20 mL) and heated at 120 °C for 3 days, then allowed to cool. The resulting colorless block-shaped crystals were filtered off, dried in air and collected in 64% yield (on the basis of Zn). Anal. calcd. for C23H15Cl4N3O4Zn: C, 45.7%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. Found: C, 45.7%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. IR (KBr, cm−1): 3,457(m), 1,649(s), 1,618(s), 1,447(m), 1,331(s), 1,229(m), 1,043(m), 839(w), 761(m), 702(s), 630(m).

Synthesis of [Cu(C<sub>8</sub>Cl<sub>4</sub>O<sub>4</sub>)(py)<sub>3</sub>] (<bold>2</bold>)

Complex (2) was obtained with CuSO4·5H2O (0.0250 g, 0.1 mmol) as a reactant by a procedure similar to Complex (1). Green block-shaped crystals were obtained in a yield of 57% based on Cu. Anal. calcd. for C23H15Cl4N3O4Cu: C, 45.8%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. Found: C, 45.8%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. IR (KBr, cm−1): 3,465(m), 1,698(s), 1,485(m), 1,446(m), 1,383(s), 1,328(s), 1,113(m), 843(w), 765(m), 702(s), 620(m).

Synthesis of [Cd(C<sub>8</sub>F<sub>4</sub>O<sub>4</sub>)(py)<sub>3</sub>] (<bold>3</bold>)

This complex was synthesized by slow vapor diffusion at room temperature. In a small vial, tetrachloroterephthalic acid (0.090 g, 0.30 mmol) and Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (0.0463 g, 0.15 mmol) were dissolved in a mixture of methanol (3 mL) and N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) (1 mL) at room temperature. The vial was then put into a larger vial containing pyridine (4 mL), which was sealed and left undisturbed for 7 days at room temperature. The yield was 65% based on Cd. Anal. calcd. for C23H15CdCl4N3O4: C, 42.4%; H, 2.3%; N, 6.5%. Found: C, 42.4%; H, 2.3%; N, 6.4%. IR (KBr, cm−1): 3,700–2,500(m), 1,601.7(s), 1,492.0(w)m, 1,437.6(s), 1,389.8(s), 1,346.8(s), 1,222.0(w), 1,119.0(w), 1,073.2(w), 1,049.6(w), 865.1(w), 757.3(w), 693.6(w), 634.8(s).
clean_text:
Synthesis of [Zn(C8Cl4O4)(py)3] (1)

A mixture of 2,3,5,6-tetrachloro-1,4-dimethyl ester (0.0664 g, 0.20 mmol) and ZnCl2 (0.0136 g, 0.10 mmol) in methanol (3 mL), pyridine (3 mL) and H2O (6 mL) was placed in a sealed vial (20 mL) and heated at 120 °C for 3 days, then allowed to cool. The resulting colorless block-shaped crystals were filtered off, dried in air and collected in 64% yield (on the basis of Zn). Anal. calcd. for C23H15Cl4N3O4Zn: C, 45.7%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. Found: C, 45.7%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3,457(m), 1,649(s), 1,618(s), 1,447(m), 1,331(s), 1,229(m), 1,043(m), 839(w), 761(m), 702(s), 630(m).

Synthesis of [Cu(C8Cl4O4)(py)3] (2)

Complex (2) was obtained with CuSO4⋅5H2O (0.0250 g, 0.1 mmol) as a reactant by a procedure similar to Complex (1). Green block-shaped crystals were obtained in a yield of 57% based on Cu. Anal. calcd. for C23H15Cl4N3O4Cu: C, 45.8%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. Found: C, 45.8%; H, 2.5%; N, 7.0%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3,465(m), 1,698(s), 1,485(m), 1,446(m), 1,383(s), 1,328(s), 1,113(m), 843(w), 765(m), 702(s), 620(m).

Synthesis of [Cd(C8F4O4)(py)3] (3)

This complex was synthesized by slow vapor diffusion at room temperature. In a small vial, tetrachloroterephthalic acid (0.090 g, 0.30 mmol) and Cd(NO3)2⋅4H2O (0.0463 g, 0.15 mmol) were dissolved in a mixture of methanol (3 mL) and N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) (1 mL) at room temperature. The vial was then put into a larger vial containing pyridine (4 mL), which was sealed and left undisturbed for 7 days at room temperature. The yield was 65% based on Cd. Anal. calcd. for C23H15CdCl4N3O4: C, 42.4%; H, 2.3%; N, 6.5%. Found: C, 42.4%; H, 2.3%; N, 6.4%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3,700-2,500(m), 1,601.7(s), 1,492.0(w)m, 1,437.6(s), 1,389.8(s), 1,346.8(s), 1,222.0(w), 1,119.0(w), 1,073.2(w), 1,049.6(w), 865.1(w), 757.3(w), 693.6(w), 634.8(s).
